fullText: This revival of William Finn and James Lapine's 1992 musical about a gay Jewish man's extended family in the early 1980s has been lovingly staged by Lapine himself with a superb cast that includes Christian Borle, Andrew Rannells and Stephanie J. Block.
dtliExcerpt: This revival of William Finn and James Lapine's 1992 musical about a gay Jewish man's extended family in the early 1980s has been lovingly staged by Lapine himself with a superb cast that includes Christian Borle, Andrew Rannells and Stephanie J. Block.
bwwExcerpt: Some of the individual moments of this Lincoln Center production are fantastic - Block, who is so well cast here and doing the best work of her Broadway career, does everything you could ask with the show's great, reflective ballads. You are never entirely convinced that Borle and Rannells are deeply in love, partly because Rannells does not sufficiently communicate the confidence that comes from being desired, but both these charming actors have moments that delight. The show centers on men in its structure, but the women in this cast all are so strong that you sense a realignment from 25 years ago.
